column3: This is certainly a step forward, but if we expect everyone to use it, shouldn't we include it in binary distributions as well - or even just install it as a command in `make install`?\n\n(I'm ambivalent on removing rpcuser/rpcpassword btw, I think they're useful enough to keep around for simple and quick authentication configuration, but that discussion doesn't need to be here)
Yes, this is a step forward in any case... utACK

Please do not remove user/pwd until bitcoin-cli can generate the creds.\nHaving to install python just for generating credentials is a PITA, probably the main reason why people are still using usr/pwd.
@NicolasDorier No worries. No one created a pull for it, so I don't think that will happen any time soon.
